Module kivakit.data.formats.xml
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.library.xml

Class XmlReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.iteration.BaseIterator<T>
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.resource.reading.BaseObjectReader<XmlNode>
        • com.telenav.kivakit.data.formats.library.xml.XmlReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.Iterator<XmlNode>
    public class XmlReader
extends BaseObjectReader<XmlNode>
    Acts as an iterator of XmlNode objects as an XML input stream is read. The stream can only be read one time (it cannot be rewound), however there is convenient functionality for randomly accessing the children of an XmlNode as an in-memory mini-DOM. The way this works is both lazy and fairly transparent:
    1. All XmlNodes are initially read as shallow objects (one node object only)
    2. If a given node's text or children are accessed and the stream has not yet been advanced, the node will be populated with (possibly nested levels of) child nodes.
    3. If a nodes children have not been accessed and the stream moves forward, those children can no longer be accessed (because there is no way to rewind and re-read the stream). Any attempt to access children of an un-populated node once the stream has moved forward will result in a run-time exception.

    The advanceTo(String) and advanceTo(Matcher) methods can be used to advance the stream to a matching node. The node can then be read with current(). The current node can be conveniently matched using lookingAt(String) or lookingAt(Matcher). The childrenMatching(Matcher), nodesMatching(Matcher) and siblingsMatching(Matcher) methods can be used to iterate through several XML nodes in the input stream.

    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)

      • advanceTo

        public XmlNode advanceTo​(Matcher<XmlNode> matcher)
        Advances to the next node matching the given matcher. If the current node matches the matcher, the input is not advanced at all.
        Parameters:
        matcher - The matcher
        Returns:
        The matching current node or null if out of input

      • advanceTo

        public XmlNode advanceTo​(java.lang.String name)
        Advances to the next open tag with the given name. If the current node matches the named open tag, the input is not advanced at all.
        Parameters:
        name - The open tag name
        Returns:
        The matching current node or null if out of input

      • advanceToButNotBeyond

        public XmlNode advanceToButNotBeyond​(Matcher<XmlNode> searchName,
                                     Matcher<XmlNode> stopMatcher)
        Advances to the next open tage with the given name, but not beyond the specified name. If the current node matches the named open tage the input is not advanced at all.
        Parameters:
        searchName - The matcher to search for
        stopMatcher - The matcher to end the search. Null can be passed in to allow advancing to the end of the stream.
        Returns:
        The matching current node or null if out of input or the stop tag has been encountered

      • advanceToButNotBeyond

        public XmlNode advanceToButNotBeyond​(java.lang.String searchName,

        Advances to the next open tag with the given name. If the current node matches the named open tag, the input is not advanced at all.
        Parameters:
        searchName - The open tag name to search
        stopName - The name to trigger a stop search
        Returns:
        The matching current node or null if out of input
